title: venison and prune stew
directions: Place a large saucepan or casserole dish on a high heat and add a little of the oil.

Brown the venison in small batches, removing it into a large bowl as you do so. Do the same with the diced bacon and add to the bowl along with the venison. Deglaze the pan with the port or wine, reduce for a few minutes and add to the bowl.

In the same pan turn down the heat to low setting, add some more oil and gently fry the onions until translucent, followed by the sliced celery. Cook for a few more minutes until the celery and onions have softened.
Add the sprigged thyme, crushed juniper, mace and cloves and stir.
Add the browned venison, bacon and reduced port, followed by the prunes and stock.
Cook on a low heat on the hob, or ideally in the oven, for 1.5 - 2 hours.
Add the carrots and Swede and cook on a low heat for another hour or 2 until the vegetables are cooked through and the venison can be cut through with a spoon.
Check the seasoning before serving, carefully adding a little more mace or cloves to taste.
Serve with buttery mashed potato and braised red cabbage.
ingredients: 800g -1kg Haunch or leg of venison, boned & cut into 1-1.5 inch cubes
4 or 5 medium sized white onions, finely sliced
1 litre good chicken or veal stock
4 or 5 carrots, halved & sliced into 1.5 cm discs
1 medium Swede, cut into 1-1.5 cm cubes
